title: Update App.tsx fallback default Valentine content and document restore precedence

requirements.summary: Update App.tsx initial in-memory default state values for landing message, video headings (keeping URLs), and final message without changing save/restore, polling, navigation, or other UI text.
acceptanceCriteria: On a fresh load with no remote saveId in the URL and no existing local saved progress, the Landing page text field is pre-filled with "Happy Valentine's Day, Apshara!".

On a fresh load with no remote saveId in the URL and no existing local saved progress, the Videos page shows the three existing remote MP4 videos and their headings are exactly ü§≠, ü§ê, and "Am I in Love with You? Definitely" (in that order).

On a fresh load with no remote saveId in the URL and no existing local saved progress, the Final Message page textarea is pre-filled with the provided final message text including the line breaks at the end.
Existing remote restore (saveId-based), global-latest restore, and local fallback restore behaviors continue to work unchanged (i.e., saved content overrides these defaults when present).

file_operations.description: Change ONLY the useState default initializers for landingMessage, videoSlots headings (keep file: null and the exact existing remote MP4 URLs), and finalMessage to match the required provided defaults; ensure no other user-facing text or existing save/restore, polling, navigation, and UI wiring is altered.

requirements.summary: Add brief inline comments near the modified App.tsx state initializers clarifying they are fallback defaults used only before restore/hydration.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/App.tsx` contains short, clear comments near `landingMessage`, `videoSlots`, and `finalMessage` initializers indicating they are fallback defaults before restore/hydration.
No new functionality is introduced; comments do not change runtime behavior.

file_operations.description: Add concise inline comments adjacent to the landingMessage, videoSlots, and finalMessage initializers noting these values are initial fallback defaults used only when no remote saveId restore, global-latest restore, or local saved progress is available; do not introduce any behavior changes.
